Automotive Asset-backed Notes

We have issued Automotive Asset-backed Notes under various securitization programs where certain automotive financing receivables secure the notes. As of December 31, 2023, the outstanding principal balance was $2.33 billion with maturity dates ranging from 2024 to 2028 and weighted average interest rates ranging from 1.82% to 6.03%.

Automotive Lease-backed Notes

We have issued various Automotive Lease-backed Notes under securitization programs where certain automotive lease receivables secure the notes. As of December 31, 2023, the outstanding principal balance was $1.28 billion with final maturity dates in 2027 and weighted average interest rate of 5.31%.

Credit Agreement

In August 2023, we entered into an unsecured revolving credit agreement providing for unsecured revolving loans of up to $5.0 billion. As of December 31, 2023, we had no outstanding borrowings under this facility. The credit agreement contains customary covenants, including:

- Maximum Consolidated Total Leverage Ratio of 3.50 to 1.00
- Minimum Interest Coverage Ratio of 3.00 to 1.00

As of December 31, 2023, we were in compliance with all covenants. Our Consolidated Total Leverage Ratio was 0.08x and our Interest Coverage Ratio was 48.2x.

TESLA Q4 2023 EARNINGS CALL TRANSCRIPT

Elon Musk, CEO: Thanks for joining us today. We had a strong finish to 2023 with record deliveries in Q4. Looking ahead to 2024, we expect vehicle volume growth may be notably lower than in 2023 as we focus on launching our next generation vehicle.

Vaibhav Taneja, CFO: For Q4, revenue was $25.2 billion, up 3% year-over-year. Automotive gross margin was 17.6%, impacted by pricing actions and increased costs. For 2024, we expect CapEx of approximately $10 billion as we continue to invest in our manufacturing capacity.

We ended the quarter with $29.1 billion in cash and investments, and total debt of $4.0 billion, giving us a very strong balance sheet with net cash of $25.1 billion.

Analyst (Morgan Stanley): Elon, can you talk about the competitive environment in EVs, especially with pricing pressure from Chinese manufacturers?

Elon Musk: Look, we've always said Tesla needs to be competitive on price. We're focused on cost reduction and our next-gen vehicle platform will have significantly lower production costs. Competition is good for the industry.
